text: Hey everybody, Google Site Search will no longer exist in 2018 (announced by Google). But HubSpot Search Engine used this technology. Do you know how we can implement a search engine without using Site Search which will be obsolete soon. Thanks !

Hey <@U3TR96G84>, we've looked at doing this for several clients, but the cost has always turned the client off. There may be a better way to do this, and I'm open to hearing what other partners say, but our solution was going to be to stand up a server just for indexing and returning results using Apache Solr <http://lucene.apache.org/solr/>. You'll then need to skin the search and results and of course charge the client for hosting it. Seems like overkill, I know, but it's fast as hell. 

Of course, it would be best if COS had search built in, it seems like something it _should_ do natively. Hint, hint …
From what I understand HubSpot is  working on it...
It would be very nice.... According to me it’s a real lack of HubSpot COS
It would be fairly simple to run a search from the api
that wouldn't work for all clients
In the meantime, here's a somewhat limited one: <https://www.growwithsms.com/blog/HubSpot-cos-modal-site-search-plugin>

Hey all, has anyone ever had a project using Canvas animations? We have an interesting project coming up for a HubSpot website build and I'm interested if anyone has any experience building out a site using cavas in HubSpot.
I've done some svg animations and what not
We are working on a native search module within HubSpot. We'll definitely let everyone know here when it's a bit closer to release -- but as of right now it's in development.
Also <!here|@here> -- Developer Day 2017 will be on September 29, 2017 at the HubSpot office in Cambridge. Registration is now open here: <https://offers.HubSpot.com/developer-day-2017>.
<@U22PU4G4A> pinned a message to this channel.
Going to be a long week for you HubSpot people
